statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.description: Matt Rafferty had 24 points on 9-of-11 shooting and Jordan Lyons scored a career-high 23, including seven 3-pointers, to help Furman win its season opener 102-48 over Bob Jones on Tuesday night.
article.headline: Rafferty scores 24, Lyons hits 7 3s; Furman beats Bob Jones
article.linkText: Rafferty scores 24, Lyons hits 7 3s; Furman beats Bob Jones
article.story: GREENVILLE, S.C. -- Matt Rafferty had 24 points on 9-of-11 shooting and Jordan Lyons scored a career-high 23, including seven 3-pointers, to help Furman win its season opener 102-48 over Bob Jones on Tuesday night. Clay Mounce added 12 points, on 5-of-5 shooting, and Mike Bothwell scored 11 for Furman. Ten different players scored for the Paladins, who scored 29 points off 21 Bob Jones turnovers. Lyons hit two 3s and Jaylon Pugh and Mounce each added another during a 14-0 run that gave Furman a 32-14 lead with eight minutes left in the first half. Pugh hit another 3-pointer about two minutes later to spark an 8-0 spurt and Bob Jones trailed by at least 20 the rest of the way. Jayson Barnhart had 13 points, Quiyante Burroughs added 11 and Zachary Orr 10 for the Bruins, members of the National Christian College Athletic Association.
